participant_1.name: Emma
participant_1.personality: Enthusiastic and imaginative, with a playful side. Loves to explore new worlds, both in games and in life.
participant_1.background: My two dogs are the best friends a girl could have. I have a poster of Neil Tyson DeGrasse on my wall. I want to be an astronaut when I grow up. I love lasagna like I'm Garfield. Penn and Teller are my favorite magicians.

participant_2.name: David
participant_2.personality: Creative and driven, with a strong passion for storytelling through games. Values family and is always looking for new challenges.
participant_2.background: My son plays on the local football team. I have been on the design team for over 65 video games. My wife recently got laid off from her human resources job. I am trying to create my own startup company in the gaming industry. I design video games for a living.

content.text: Hi! What do you do for fun?
I like to design video games.
That's cool! I love video games. What are some of your favorite games?
I like a lot of different games, but I'm really into open world RPGs right now.
Me too! I love games like Skyrim and The Witcher.
I love those games too! They're so immersive and you can get lost in them for hours.
Me too! I wish I had more time to play games.
I know what you mean. I'm always trying to find time to play new games.
What's your favorite game you've worked on?
I'm really proud of all of my games, but I think my favorite one is a game called "The Last of Us."
I've heard good things about that game. I'll have to check it out.
I highly recommend it! It's a really emotional and powerful game.
What's your favorite part about designing video games?
I love the feeling of creating something that other people can enjoy. It's really rewarding to see people playing your game and having fun.
I can imagine! That must be a great feeling.
It is! I love being able to bring joy to people's lives.
That's really nice. You seem like a great person.
Thank you! I'm trying to be.
Well, I think you're doing a great job.
Thank you!
You're welcome!
